Fields.DialogueText: *rattle*
*clink*
Time!
Domo. I still think I can do better. Set up the next batch for me, please.
Right away, Hachi no Kami.
That’s quite the oyster catch, Hachi-chan.
Hai, Kanchou! I made sure to collect enough for everyone.
Had I learned sooner that eating oysters raw was a practice the world over, I’d have done this more frequently.
... Although the way some of the gaijin crew members drown their meal in sauce is disappointing...
Everyone’s tastes are a little different. Have you been shucking all of them?
No, Kanchou, just the ones for members who don’t know how. It surprised me: some of the Westerners actually can do it themselves.
Well enough that you’ve made a competition out of it, I see. So, who holds the speed title? You, Hachi-chan?
Sadly, that is a title I cannot claim. The speediest are from the galley. I have been making some progress, but it appears I need to modify my technique further.
To account for...?
My gun barrels.
Ah. It still looks like you’re faster than the folks cleaning off the shells, so you can’t be that slow.
Perhaps. But if I don’t push myself to be faster, I’ll never know if I’ve honed my technique as far as I am able.

Fields.MenuText: If you’re that serious, then I should put you to the test myself. I can’t have my vessel outdoing me now, can I?
That’s a great worth ethic, but just being able to open one of them at all means you’ve got me beat. Shouldn’t that be enough?
I don’t recall any Morganas that could be bested with just an oyster knife. Don’t forget why we’re out here, Hachi-chan.

Fields.DialogueText: I couldn’t do that, Kanchou! You’re my superior officer, after all.
My apologies, Kanchou! I did not mean to imply that there was anything wrong with that...
Hai, Kanchou! I will redirect my energies!
No excuses, Hachi-chan. Now, where can a captain get a knife and some oysters around here?
Give me three minutes, Captain.
By the way, Hachi-chan, you gathered this all yourself, right? These weren’t part of anyone else's catch, I trust...
Fear not, Kanchou. The Ama Okaasama I met was very clear on the subject of gathering in coastal waters. I found these were under the minefield we were charting earlier.
Even so...
In addition, I had the radio operator on duty transmit an inquiry. I received permission.
Okay, then. Well done.
Ah! The radio...
... Message incoming... It’s a distress call, Kanchou.
Hachi-chan’s oyster bar is hereby closed. Store the rest for later and prepare to sail.
Hai!
@BATTLE
*woosh*
*click*
*woosh*
You were honest about being on your time, Hachi-chan. Here we are on the surface - and, sure enough, I find you on deck, practicing your mental sharpness drills.
Kanchou.
*sheathes blade*
I apologize if I led you to misinterpret this kata.
This is to put the memory of the movements I want to make firmly in my muscles, so that my attacks and counterattacks can reach the level of reflex.
So this *is* sword practice, then.

Fields.MenuText: You mean your moves don’t already have that level? I thought that since you wore a blade, it meant you knew how to fully use it.
Now that you mention it, Hachi-chan, you use a sword rather than, say, a knife of some sort. Isn’t a sword a bit harder to swing under water?
I hope you maintain some sort of target practice as well, Hachi-chan.

Fields.DialogueText: Sadly, Kanchou, my knowledge only goes back to my launch. Lieutenant Maeno has introduced his sensei to me, so I learn new things when we are home and practice when we are not.
Instruction can only take me so far however, and the style I use is largely of my own making... I know of no school for a warrior bearing a pair of 11th Year Type naval guns on her arms.
That is so, Kanchou. However, a guntō may make thrusts as well as cuts - so, while limited, I can still perform effective attacks.
I’d like to think it increases my options, rather than limiting them.
Absolutely, Kanchou. It would be shameful of me to take aim at an opponent - both above and below the surface - and miss due to improper technique.
That aside, Kanchou, I believe you will want return to the conning tower.
Between the coded message the operator on duty is receiving and the message I’m receiving from a nearby Kami of the Fleet... I suspect we may be submerging soon.
@BATTLE
Kanchou?
Just thought I'd take in a little fresh air and see how you're doing... and now I see my timing is no good.
Unfortunately not.
@BATTLE
Shiosai ni/Irago no shimabei/kogu fune ni/imo noruranka/araki shimami wo
(Translation: In the boat that sails about the isle of Irago/When the tides clash and brawl/Will the court ladies venture forth?/Ah, those raging waters round the isle!)
I didn’t take you for a poetry lover, Hachi-chan.
His Majesty Emperor Meiji decreed that his subjects should pursue learning and cultivate arts, and thereby develop intellectual faculties and perfect moral powers.
Even now, the youth of the Empire of Japan memorize those words. This then, is my means for following his decree. For this is not just any poetry: it’s a volume of the Manyōshū.
An anthology of work from the earliest of Yamato poets. It’s a primer on the historical spirit and virtues of the Yamato people, before they were enshrouded in Continental influences.

Fields.MenuText: Hm. Are there any contemporary poets that you like? It’d be kind of sad if the height of Japanese poetic expression was, what? Over a thousand years ago?
I’ll take your word about its effectiveness as a manual for morality. But what makes you that sure it isn’t just any poetry? What are you comparing it to, Shakespearean sonnets?
Wonderful. Any advice from the ages on how to reinforce the stabilizer on a Watanabe E9W1?

Fields.DialogueText: Some have come close, but none have recaptured the raw, simple sentiment of that age.
There once was a man from Nantucket, who-
Never mind, Hachi-chan.
... No, Kanchou.
Remind me how many volumes of the Manyōshū there are?
Twenty volumes, Kanchou. Over 4,500 poems in all.
... You're going to be at that for a while.
*whispering* Distance to target: fifteen thousand meters. Now, Kanchou?
*shakes head*
*whispering* Distance to target: fourteen thousand meters. ... Now, Kanchou?
*whispering* Not yet.
!!! ... Incoming Kami transmission...
So much for running silent! Plan B!
@BATTLE
Okay, Hachi-chan - while we have the bridge to ourselves for a few seconds. What happened?
My deepest apologies, Kanchou. I take full responsibility for my unprofessional behavior and will take steps to ensure it does not happen again.
That does not change the fact that my behavior jeopardized our mission, however. I await my punishment.
Okay, let’s first start by having you explain what just happened in the first place.
Hai, Kanchou! While under strict operational silence in order to make our attack on Cowardice, I received a... well, a high-frequency radio burst from a Belle in distress.
Do we have a location? If she needs assistance-
It was too brief, Kanchou. I don't even know who it was.
And she said she was being targeted by an Injustice. That...

Fields.MenuText: That makes it worse.
See, now I really wish we could be there with guns blazing.
Are you okay?

Fields.DialogueText: ... It shouldn't make a difference.
Hai.
It's kind of you to ask, Kanchou. But I'm not the issue here.
This war has a lot of "shoulds" and "shouldn'ts" that don't really seem to work out.
... Anyway. There's no reason to believe we're the only Neutrality Fleet group that received the distress signal. No point in giving up hope - just keep your ears open.
Hai.
And I know we've been thoroughly debriefed on our... Injustice issues, but let's get the word out that we're ready to talk, one-on-one, with any other ships having problems with her.
Or versions of her. Whatever. If Injustice-stalking is an ongoing concern-
It... might be, Kanchou.
Rumblings in the Belle grapevine?
So desu. Sometimes, other Kami ask me questions about the one we encountered. I respectfully inform them that I have no more insight now than I did right after the debriefing.
She’s a Funayūrei... how should I know what goes on in her head?
I know what you mean, Hachi-chan. All right, then... the captains’ network may not be as expedient as the one you Belles have, but I’ll see what we can do with it.
But, Kanchou... it shouldn’t be necessary for you to get involved. Not like this. If Kami are reaching out to me for help, it's *my* duty to-
Yeah, no. When the Morganas attacked, you were so determined to help, you made yourselves - you made *yourself* - alive.
I feel the same way where you’re concerned, Hachi-chan. If something is troubling you, I’m not about to stand around if there’s something I can do about it.
And I'm certainly not going to be passive about other ships in the Neutrality Fleet being harassed or worse.
Kanchou... arigatō.
No need. Anyway - I’d say we’re done here.
Kanchou? But I haven’t received my punishment.
I think you punish yourself too much as it is.
But, fine - if you want suffering to clear away your sins, Hachi-chan, work on stepping up our coordination with other Belles. And give me progress reports on the Injustice issue.
And, be warned - if you need the warning - not all Belles are as obliging as you are. Expect willful independence and stubbornness.
As they should expect stubbornness from me, Kanchou.
So, Hachi-chan, what do you think of our latest orders? Yokosuka!
Yes... returning home.
I thought you’d be thrilled to swim in familiar waters, Hachi-chan. Not to mention a chance to watch one or two of those street plays you like at the port...
That *is* something I look forward to on our return visits... kamishibai appears to be unique to my homeland.
So what’s wrong, then? Unless you’re due for regular maintenance every fifteen-to-thirty thousand miles or something, this sounds like just another transport mission.
Normally I would agree with you, Kanchou. This is just another mission and I was requested by name because I have demonstrated myself to be trustworthy.
It’s just that the wording of the orders seems... off. It’s somehow... stiffer... than the usual.
It's probably best not to take that kind of thing too personally. There's just no way to know what other pressures are in play when orders get written.
That is true, but... Kanchou, one shouldn't just blind oneself to contextual information.
What is unsaid can often speak volumes to one who relates with the speaker.
And you think what wasn’t said this time fills more volumes than the Manyōshū.
I wouldn’t go that far...

Fields.MenuText: You’ve got a good head on your shoulders, Hachi-chan. If you think something about this is off, then I believe you. Are you suggesting we decline, or at least drag our heels a bit?
In other words, be prepared for the unexpected. Good advice even in familiar waters... feel free to pass the word, Hachi-chan, so that all hands stay alert.
If what you’re saying is true, then all the more reason to go: we won’t separate the unsaid from the silence out here.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all, Kanchou. There must be for an important reason to recall me home and timing may be imperative.
Hai!
So desu, Kanchou. I'm glad you think so.
Just to be clear: if I understand what you’re implying here, we may be sailing into something beyond Protection Fleet business.
I’ll take my cues from you, but if it doesn’t sit right with me I *will* say no. Can we agree on that beforehand?
I believe you understand my feelings on certain matters... so, yes, I can agree.
Good. Then let’s wrap up this patrol and slip away to Yokosuka.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Hachijojima, hm?
Now I know there’s something written between the lines of those orders. I’m going to love hearing why the last-minute divert to this lovely little patch of nowhere...
I’m... sure there must be a good reason.

Fields.MenuText: Besides not being seen? There’s a difference between low key and covert, Hachi-chan.
I’m sure there’s a reason. I reserve the right to judge whether it’s a good reason or not.
I’m all ears, Hachi-chan.

Fields.DialogueText: At least the dock isn’t deserted.
Hachi no Kami. Hachi no Daisa. Welcome... you are right on time. I am Yamada from Stores and I am here to assist with your resupply.
We have your standard requisition with us now... here is the list. If you require anything in addition, let me know and we can arrange for it to be waiting for you.
That’s somewhat difficult, since we have no idea where we’re going.
... Or why we’re here, for that matter.
Regrettably, I can only give you the coordinates for your next destination, and assist in your swiftest departure in any way that I can.
And you don’t have orders to supply answers. Or do you have orders-
Ensign, your loyalty and righteousness are commendable. What is your name, so that I can send a letter of praise to your superior officer?
I am Taro, but your praise is unnecessary, Hachi-no-Kami, for I am but a humble military officer doing his duty.
I see. With my assistance, we should have everything on this list loaded by-
Just a minute. I’ll accept a last-minute switch in harbors and even a blink-and-you’ll miss-it visit, but not this. We’re out here to find Morganas, not to play musical harbors.
My apologies. Were it not for claustrophobia, I would accompany you and provide more insight on what is being asked of you.
That must wait until you reach your next destination, I’m afraid. But I will say this: if you reject it, this mission will fail.
... Kanchou?
... There’s a briefing waiting at the next stop. We’ll decide whether to fish or cut bait based on that. So, Ensign, where are we headed?
@BATTLE
Ah, yes. Standing at a lonely dock, waiting for mysterious instructions. This never gets old.
We didn’t have to deviate from our course this time...
Thank goodness for small favors. That, and they’re expecting us...
Hachi no Kami, Hachi no Daisa, what happened? We were anticipating your arrival before this.
Morganas along the way.
What?! You didn't engage them, did you?
Of course we did. It’s my mission, Ensign...?
Yamada. Taro Yamada. How could you do that? Of all the things you could have done-

Fields.MenuText: Hold on, Ensign. Rearranging the furniture and then pitching a fit when we trip over it is not something you get to do.
And will do again, unless you have a very good reason not to.
Just to be clear, you are not in the process of berating a Japanese Kami of the Fleet for challenging a Morgana in waters this close to the Home Islands.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, of course. I momentarily forgot you haven’t been briefed yet. My apologies, Hachi no Daisa. To you as well, Hachi no Kami.
You would understand if you had been briefed...  Ah, well. Shikata ga nai. My apologies, Hachi no Kami, Hachi no Daisa.
I... merely meant that the sensuikan... way of combat is... a bit more... direct... than this situation might warrant.
Then enlighten us, if you would.
Hai, Hachi no Daisa! But, if I may ask...
Were you able to identify the dominant Funayūrei?
The core of the group was a Delusion. Why?
I see! Then all may not be lost. Once the last of your requisitions are stored and refueling is complete we should depart.
That is good news, but... where should I have Navigation chart a course to?
And why? What’s this all about?
We... should be circumspect while we're on land. Do I have permission to board?
Granted. Now, would you please tell my Kanchou and I what we are being asked to do? The next step, if not the full mission?
*hushed* You are to sail East, beyond Formosa. I do not know how far it is to the rendezvous point... only that when we arrive, we are to take aboard a passenger and return here.
That sounds simple enough... if still pretty vague.
You will be able to give us more details when we are at sea?
Hai.
I can’t wait to hear them.
May we assume that we can engage any enemies we encounter en route?
If necessary.
Urgently so, I think.
Ah. Great.
@BATTLE
All right, Yamada-san. What’s going on?
Yes, well...  Some time ago, a... very important person... was traveling to the Continent by airplane. His flight was challenged over the East China Sea by the Funayūrei identified as Delusion.
Not His Imperial Majesty...!
No, no. If His Imperial Majesty required transport, a suitable Kami would have been given the mission.
Ah. Of course.
That still doesn’t explain things. You didn’t sound too heartbroken when you found out Delusion was the Morgana we ran into, and if this was a simple search and rescue... or recovery...
We’d already be in the East China Sea.
You see it clearly - as expected of a Kami of the Fleet and her kanchou.  We believe the crew supplied him with a parachute at some point and tried to draw attention away from him after he jumped.
Since then, we have been informed that he was rescued safe and unharmed.
That’s good news.

Fields.MenuText: This is starting to sound like Good News, Bad News: attacked is bad, rescued is good. We’re back to bad news, then... so what is it?
As I said before, if this was a simple operation, the word wouldn’t be mum. Kindly cut to the chase, Ensign.
So who's got him?

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
I’m afraid there is no delicate way to put this...
Yes, you are right; time is of the essence.
Please don’t rebuke your kanchou, Hachi no Kami, this matter deserves such direct language. Your commanding officer has cut to the core of the matter.
His rescue was by another Funayūrei. ... Our mission is to make contact with her and return with him to Makō, so that he may continue to his destination on the continent.
Impossible! No Funayūrei would return a person. No Funayūrei would rescue a person!
They rescue people, Hachi. They just don’t return them intact most of the time.
Ensign, you may not have had access to the reports about Morgana experimentation and... systems of control. They can be destructive.
My superiors have reason to believe the gentleman has been left unmolested.
So, who is this Funayūrei?
We don’t know. Only that she will guide you to her with a song.
Are these His Imperial Majesty's orders?
... His Imperial Majesty would appreciate it if you were to undertake this task, but recognizes that your daisa has final say on the matter.
And if I say no?
The message indicated that, in making the exchange, any more than one Kami of the Fleet would be seen as a threat to her, and that only the Kami of a submarine could accomplish this task.
This... has been deemed a private issue.
Even if it were not, I would not want another Kami to be sent on a mission that I can accomplish.
That’s all well and good, Hachi-chan, but it means we’re being asked to go east until we run into either a singing Morgana or Baja, California.
That is one way to look at it, yes.
Did the message say anything about Funayūrei who don’t sing?
@BATTLE
You haven’t given any orders yet, Kanchou.
No. I haven't.
Why? The longer we hesitate...

Fields.MenuText: The more it smells like a trap.
The less I like it. What was that about keeping one’s word and seeing those words through to the end, Hachi-chan?
The more we think this through and the better our chances of success.

Fields.DialogueText: But it’s also true that Funayūrei are little more than a mob, with no sense of loyalty. If one of them is base enough to engage with us, why shouldn’t we take advantage of it?
We’re also dealing with one that sends coherent messages, Hachi-chan. It means she knows how to use her head. I don’t know about you, but it automatically makes her dangerous in my book.
... Faithfulness and righteousness are the ordinary duties of man, but in the soldier and the sailor, in particular, cannot be without them and remain in the ranks even for a day, Kanchou.
But... by leaving Makō, haven’t we already accepted this mission?
Which is why I like this situation less and less, Hachi-chan.
You are a model of true valor, Kanchou. ... But I’m confused. We sail until we find the singing Funayūrei and she turns over the individual we’ve been tasked to transport to our care.
How much deliberation is necessary for that?
We still don’t even know who the “singing Funayūrei” is... what if she turns out to be Disease, Hachi-chan? What if our hostage is a plague-carrier?
... I see your point now, Kanchou.
*You're* still keen on taking the mission?
I am. You have asked me before, Kanchou, what I believe. I believe that His Imperial Majesty finds this missing individual important enough to send a Kami to investigate.
I believe that I and the crew are up to the task: If he is still alive, we are capable of collecting and returning him to his intended course safely.
If he is not, or if she decides to renege on her offer, we will punish the Funayūrei that would use his status as bait that way.
Fair enough. I made an inquiry with the Fleet; there haven't been any Injustice-led group sightings within striking distance of our route. It's not conclusive, but it's... reassuring.
All right, then... first, we need a way to track our songbird. I’d rather not have to throttle every Morgana we meet just to get directions.
Kanchou! Permission to throttle one more not-singing Funayūrei?
@BATTLE
Have you...
*Petty Officer Hutchinson brandishes Hachi's Hyōshigi - a set of hardwood clappers - and hurriedly smacks them together.*
Hutchinson-san, if you’re going to be so slow, only strike it once! That was enough to summon the spirits of the dead!
Or a soggy Belle, at least. Should I ask why you're swimming blindfolded?
Ka-kanchou!
*takes off blindfold* Moushi wake gozaimasen! I'm so sorry! I didn't know you were there!
Hutchinson, I think I’ll get Hachi-chan’s progress report. Do you think you could get her something hot, while she’s on deck?
Of course. Captain, Hachi no Kami, if you will excuse me...

Fields.MenuText: I hope you don’t always give the crew grief like that. They’re already willing to go to hell and back for you... and with you. Offer a little patience, and they always will.
It sounds to me like you need to work out a little more elaborate code for you and your surface contacts, Hachi-chan. Communication is a two-way thing, after all.
That was hardly an example of kindness to someone of lower rank, Hachi-chan. Or do I need to remind someone about an earlier incident involving volume issues?

Fields.DialogueText: I understand, Kanchou. You make it look so easy...
I'll take that as a compliment.
So is propriety, Kanchou. I... will take responsibility for surfacing blind and making a fool of myself, but that is not the way to demonstrate the need for improved codes, either.
That is unnecessary, Kanchou. You showed leniency to me at that time and I understand why I should as well.
... I also know, however, that If the heart be not sincere, words and deeds, however good, are all mere outward show. There are times I do not believe respect shown me is genuine.
That may be the difference between respect owed and respect freely given, Hachi-chan.
So. Any luck?
I haven’t heard anything I would call singing... but my own diesel engines add to the noise, so I could easily miss a quiet one far away.
This may require finding a Funayūrei by some other means and approaching her quietly enough to listen for one.
Good idea. And the blindfold?
To help me focus. Like this...
*blindfold on* ...!!
Funayūrei!
I guess the extra focus helped.
@BATTLE
Still no luck?
Well, finding a Funayūrei I can do. Finding a singing Funayūrei is turning out to be not so easy.

Fields.MenuText: Keep trying, Hachi-chan. If there’s a singing Morgana out here, I know you’ll catch her in the act.
I’m starting to get concerned, Hachi-chan. Even if this isn’t a trap - which is still a real possibility - we’re very visible out here.
Told you so.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you for your words of support, Kanchou. I won’t let you down!
I understand, Kanchou. You are right: we are exposed. Moreover, the more of a trail we leave, the easier we make it for someone like Injustice to find us.
Too bad we can’t stop and ask for directions.
I may have just located some Funayūrei who will answer us. We're going to need to give them a chance to start running at the end.
@BATTLE
So, what's your thinking?
Interesting - and I like your confidence.
Kanchou... it's just intuition.
I'm comfortable with that.
We gave the enemy a few minutes to try to escape when they were too badly damaged to finish us. I hope that they were trying to run *toward* something.
Reinforcements?
Or weaker ships to cannibalize - even one of their own, if she's alone, and singing songs that might draw their attention.
Interesting. Possibly inspired.
Thank you, Kanchou!
Well, we have a course. Let's see where it takes us.
*humming*
It's not singing, but...
I recognize the tune. It's "Kagome Kagome."
And the place is Hahajima. Lot of ways the environment could be used against us.
Do we have eyes on our songbird?
Hai. But she's not alone, Kanchou.
Or... she is, but she's being pursued by other Funayūrei.
Pursued or just followed?
Kanchou, I think they fired a torpedo at her.
Damn! If anybody's going to do that, it's going to be us! Hachi-chan, I hate to say it, but: she needs a rescue!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Right. Still no radio contact with Corruption?
No, Kanchou. But she's not firing at us, either. Do you... are we confident that she's the one we're after? She might just be humming for the sake of humming.
Right. Well, the instructions called for a submarine to make the approach alone - let's oblige her. But look out for mines.
Hai, Kanchou. At this point, I can smell the things from-
*SCRAPING SOUND*
A net?!
Full stop! Full stop!
*jangling bells, clappers*
Ah ah ahhhhhh...
Too late! It’s a fishing net - my net cutter will-
She's... is she leaving?
... But how dare she use a net!

Fields.MenuText: I know you despise them. If she does it again we use the jumping wire to go under, instead of through it.

Fields.DialogueText: ... She's leaving. Get us out of this thing, Hachi-chan.
Hai, Kanchou. I'm working on it.

Fields.MenuText: If that was her ace up her sleeve, she just squandered it. We know what she’s capable of now...
Do you suppose it was for us, or for Venom?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Or I put hole in it big enough for my hull not to get caught. Or just avoid it altogether and go around, if I can help it.
Exactly.
Credit where credit is due. It was effective enough.
*sigh* Yes, it was. Never to despise an inferior enemy or fear a superior, but to do one’s duty as soldier or sailor - this is true valor.
I'm almost free, Kanchou. We can pursue as soon as-
Make sure we deal with the net.
Kanchou?
It’s the least we can do for the next ship. Also, I’d like to have it checked... she may have left some clues on where we can find her.
I’ll keep that in mind. ... Excuse me, Kanchou, but I plan to “deal with it” personally.
Hm.
... I think we have to risk it.
Hai.
We’re nearing the coordinates on the note, Kanchou. I’m still amazed that you knew.
Don't give me too much credit - I wasn't expecting a message in a bottle in a net. And I’m as in the dark as anyone about the rest of the message: you can’t sing if you aren’t on the surface?
Perhaps it is her way of confirming that we are here to actually meet for the transfer. It’s possible we could have picked up her trail accidentally, and wouldn’t know about it.
Maybe.
You sent for me, Kanchou?
Yes. I thought you said the message was to send a submarine - surface ships need not apply.
... It wasn't in those terms, but that was the general idea.
Do you know the exact words?
I... was made aware of them, yes. In case the message itself was needed to prove our claim as transport vessel.

Fields.MenuText: Corruption didn’t ask for it. It still might have hints, though...
Unless I miss my guess, this is your first patrol. By now you must have noticed - Morganas have their own twisted logic. For us to succeed, we need every detail.
Let me remind you that you go where this ship goes.

Fields.DialogueText: If you think it will aid you, Kanchou...
I understand, Kanchou. This is what was received...
I do not fear death, Kanchou. The shame of failure would be unbearable however, so if it will help you succeed in this, I will share what I know.
"... I also see no reason why one Funayūrei can’t haunt another, and I believe you would hound me for all eternity if you even thought negligence on my part brought our ruin."
"Yamato’s envoy to Ryūjin is being entertained in Ryūgū-jō. Tamatorihime is all the escort he requires. When she comes to fetch him a knife is not needed, only a sharp ear: the music will guide her."
... Well, that cleared everything up.
@BATTLE
There’s clearly a story behind this.
There is. Ryūjin is kami of the sea. He is a dragon and his underwater palace is Ryūgū-jō.
Right. That explains the need for us. What about “Tamatorihime,” and whether she’s armed or not?
Ryūjin took a treasure - a pearl - meant as tribute to the late founder of the Fujiwara clan. His son sought to take it back. In his quest, he met and married an ama, who bore him a son.
That ama - Princess Tamatori - dove all the way to Ryūgū-jō and took back the pearl for her husband and son. To escape pursuit, she sliced her own breast and tucked the pearl inside.
She reached shore with the pearl, then died from her wound.
I see. Incidentally, how many times have you heard that story?
At least twice... well, one and a half times... during visits home. The storyteller tells it with such energy - it’s an audience favorite.

Fields.MenuText: You know that sword practice of yours, Hachi-chan? Keep up the good work.
With you in the audience, I don’t doubt that. Still, I may offer some advice next time we’re in port. Repeats are fine, but they shouldn’t crowd out new stories.
It sounds to me like your Princess would have done herself better to have brought a catch-bag instead of a knife.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou?
Never mind.
I suppose you have a point, Kanchou. As motivational as the tale of Tamatorihime is, I pride myself on not being in port long...
There is... another reason why that portion of the Funayūrei’s message would be significant.
Arming Hachi no Kami with a knife would mean death was the only outcome for her - either on the spears of her enemy or...
With her own knife. In other words, it’s an assurance that Hachi-chan will succeed... or at least the Morgana believes she will.
Kanchou... there's something I'm still not confident about. Do you think that Corruption has Yamato’s envoy to Ryūjin? She *was* singing... humming...
I'm not confident about that, either. I wouldn’t put all this past her, but something still seems off.
And the trick we pulled to get the course that led to her... It wasn't exactly scientific.
Yeah, but it wasn't bad, either. We just need to - I know that look on your face.
... Avarice is close. And singing.
On our current course?
It’s almost the exact opposite.
Can you tell what she’s singing? Is the same song as Corruption’s?
It’s definitely not "Kagome Kagome," as Corruption was humming... but... my apologies, Kanchou. I’ve never heard it before.
Between the distance and our diesel motors, the hydrophone can’t hear a thing, Captain. Hachi no kami, could you sing it for me, please? Even humming a little would do...
What good-
Please?
What could it hurt, Hachi-chan?
... Very well...
*hums*
Captain, Hachi no Kami... that’s "Habanera." From "Carmen."
@BATTLE
That answers that.
Kanchou?
The music will guide her, the message said. I was wondering if it was *any* music or not.
Avarice appeared genuinely surprised to see us.
Exactly. Which means not just ‘any’ singing Morgana will do.
Return to course for Corruption’s coordinates, but let me know the second we hear "Kagome Kagome" again, no matter which Morgana is doing the singing.
Hai!
Here we are. Any sign of Corruption?
Kanchou! We’re surrounded!
Stay calm, Hachi-chan! We were invited; unless there's a dominant Injustice here, the extras could be to make sure we don’t do anything funny.
... There's Injustice, Kanchou. And look at the scars on her.
The one we fought before?
Hai.
... Okay. All bets are now officially off.
How wonderful, Hachi! You came to play...
You! Where’s Corruption?
Oh, she’s somewhere around here...  But she’s not who you really came to see. She merely provided the music to guide you here, to me.
It’s so good to see you again. You’re looking well, you and that oni of yours... that is the same one, right? It has similar markings to the one you had before, but...
You’re looking far better than the last time we saw you, too.
The same one, then. I made sure to clean up for when I met you again, Hachi. ... And so we meet again. Didn’t I tell you then that I would follow you to the ends of the earth?
You only have yourself to blame for putting your mark on me... both figuratively and literally. ... Still, you made your desires loud and clear... you’ve grown tired of Tag.
I understand; if anyone should be the oni for our games of Onigokko and Kakure-Oni, it ought be you and your menagerie...
Enough of your babble, Funayūrei! We have come, now release your prisoner!
Not my prisoner, Hachi, my guest. He isn’t here; he is still in Ryūgū-jō. And Hachi, you don’t seem to understand, which means you’re playing a game where I know the rules and you don’t.
That doesn’t seem fair now, does it?

Fields.MenuText: It just means we don’t know which of your own rules you you’re breaking.
When has fairness ever stopped you?
Killing us from old age while we wait for you get to the point doesn’t sound fair either.

Fields.DialogueText: If you’re going to carry parasites, Hachi, you should at least have ones less naive than that one. Why break rules when most are so full of loopholes you could sift for gold with them?
Your oni says the most amusing things, Hachi. Doesn’t it know ALL's fair in love and war?
Oh, is that what you meant, Hachi? Forgive me for beating around the bush; I enjoy talking to you so much that I do tend to get long winded.
As for this game and its rules, it’s all there in the song.
What do you mean?
I’m disappointed, Hachi, that you didn’t recognize it from the start, with Corruption...
Kagome kagome, kago no naka no tori wa, itsu itsu deyaru... Yoake no ban ni, tsuru to kame ga subetta, ushiro no shoumen daare...
She's leaving. I guess the shooting's about to start. Hachi-chan?
Ushiro no shoumen daare...
Hachi-chan. Reflect on the lyrics later.
Hai!
@BATTLE
*whispering* We're safely submerged, Kanchou. I don't think she's seen us.
Ay yi yi! Aye aye, ai, I... eye?
Eye Ate?
She said you’d know, Eye Ate. Said you’d say...
*whispering* She's withdrawing. I assume we hold fire?
*whispering* For now.
What do you think, Hachi-chan? Do you know what’s going on, or is Injustice yanking Confusion’s chain?
I do know... but I also don’t, Kanchou. Kagome kagome is part of a children’s game, where one is blindfolded and the others sing it and move in a circle around him or her.
Then the oni, the child in the middle, has to guess who is directly behind him or her when the song ends.
A perfectly sensible game, unless the person behind you has a fifty caliber slingshot or two. ... Or ten...
Hai - but why this game? How many other Funayūrei are out here stalking us - pardon me, *circling* us - and how do we notify the Fleet?

Fields.MenuText: One - because she can. Two - probably every Morgana she could sucker into this, however many that is. Three - I’m open to suggestions.
You’re taking this situation very well, Hachi-chan, I’m proud of you. Stay calm and thoughtful and we will find answers to all your questions.

Fields.DialogueText: I think we can speak a bit more normally, Kanchou. But don't shout - there are more enemies nearby than we can easily handle.
And, even if we won, a Grand Guignol blowout wouldn't do the hostage any good if he's anywhere nearby. Agreed.

Fields.MenuText: All very good questions. We start with getting the call out, and answer the "why" and "who" during the wait for reinforcements.

Fields.DialogueText: Let me think...
I’m only doing what any sailor in His Imperial Majesty’s fleet should do, Kanchou.
Hai.
Kanchou, I have an idea. It involves risk, but if it works...
You're sure this is okay, Kanchou? I appreciate your faith in me, but...
I think it's the right call, Hachi-chan. We play the game.
... You can start singing whenever you're ready.
"Circle you, circle you, the bird inside the basket, when oh when can it come out, in the night of dawn, the crane and turtle slipped..."
*whispering* She's coming...
"Who is it behind you?"
Eye Ate!
Confusion!
... You are?
No, you are. ... Well, hurry up!
Huh?
Baka Maru... You’re holding up the game! By the end of the song, I’m supposed to guess who is behind me. That was you.
Oh...
Now you’re supposed to take my place in the center and I join the others. So tell me the way to your part of the circle, and get in the center already!
Hurry up now, so that we can start again!
Oh! That way. ... And I... take... your place...
That’s right.
Okay! Bye bye, Confusion!
... Kanchou, she's... she's sailing off.

Fields.MenuText: A match of wits against an unarmed opponent. That was priceless, Hachi.
I still can’t believe you pulled that off, but you did. Well done, Hachi.
The Morgana trap is open. Set course for the edge of the picket, and let’s get the hell out of here.

Fields.DialogueText: I haven’t escaped the trap yet, Kanchou. ... But that was rather fun, I’ll admit.
I must thank the storyteller at home for all his tales about Hare for that performance, Kanchou.
Hai, Kanchou!
*coming in faintly* Confusion? Is here center? And... Eye Ate...  Eye ate... me? No...  Eye ate... gone.  My eyes, gone. Ate. By me? Or...  Confusion? Eat for me my eyes? Confusion? She went away...
Did I win?
@BATTLE
That’s all it is, Petty Officer.
With all due respect, Hachi no Kami, there must be more, if Injustice believes it’s all there-
Easy, easy you two. I thought I asked for a course suggestion once we have our bearings again.
And I would like to give you one... except there is nothing I can recommend.
It is just as I told Confusion; it’s just a children’s game, where the one in the center guesses the person in the ring who is directly behind them.
Except that there’s more to it than that... there are any number of ways to interpret the lyrics, Captain.
Such as?
Kagome can be a woven basket. The "bird in a cage" could be a chicken brought home from market, and if "the crane and the turtle slipped" is taken as the bad sign that it is...
Then "who is behind you now" is probably a cook with a cleaver.
Right. If the bird is metaphorical, then the song can be a taunt to a prisoner soon to be executed by the dawn patrol... or the despair of the new girl to a brothel.

Fields.MenuText: "Who is it behind you" takes on a whole new meaning with that one.
Were you aware of these interpretations before, Hachi-chan?
And I thought "when the bough breaks the cradle will fall and down will come baby, cradle and all" was dark...

Fields.DialogueText: Well... no. The words are sung, not written down, but... she is right, the words could be interpreted those ways. I just never thought of them in any other way than as a song for a game.
Hutchinson, you said "kagome" can be a woven basket. What else can it be... or do I want to know?
Well... It could be a corruption of kagomi - a pregnant woman. The baby would be the "bird" in her "cage," and the cane and turtle took a spill because she was pushed...  making it a whodunnit.
Terrific.
"Kagome" is also the name of a specific basket weave-pattern... it’s a hexagon with triangles at every side. The hexagons can be eyes, or eyeholes...
Kago no me - the eyes of the cage.
Right. The word for "bird" could also be a corruption of torii - a shrine gate. "Kagome" could describe a wicker fence on the shrine’s perimeter with that pattern.
What if... the "crane" is Suzaku, the Vermillion Bird of the South, and "turtle" is Genbu, the Black Tortoise of the North.
And if... "the night of dawn" isn’t time, but directions... the dawn is the rising sun - the East - and the night is West...
It sounds as if all four directions have been cut off. The shrine is under siege, with attackers maintaining watch through the eyeholes in the fence. For someone inside the compound...
It’s only a matter of time before the target is caught.
... Yes. Well...  Grandmother was also convinced that it’s the key to finding of the hidden treasure of the Tokugawa Shoguns-
Location...  Direction...
Charts! Charts!
*ALARM*
... First Corruption, then charts!
@BATTLE
Frowning at that chart won’t make it talk, you know.
It doesn’t need to, Kanchou. What I need is there, I just need to determine what is there to trick me...  Lieutenant, fetch Ensign Yamada for me please.
Right away, Hachi no Kami.
You have an idea.
I do. She said her guest was not with her... meaning he is wherever Ryūgū-jō is. Funayūrei or not, if we locate that place, we can make a rescue.
That makes sense. Do you know where her undersea palace is?
No, but I know how to find it, Kanchou. She’s playing Kagome Kagome with me... I first need to determine the size of the ring I’m contained in.
... Hachi-chan, those are charts for the Indian Ocean. If you’re looking at a circle as big as I think you are...
It is vast, yes. But it’s not the area within the ring, but the ring itself that’s important.
How can I help you, Hachi no-
She rescued him. I need to know where - and you know that information, don’t you?
But... Delusion was the Funayūrei that attacked.
Yes, and she may have even come up with the idea, but likely the details like where and when were provided by Injustice.
The transport was too big to interest a carrier Funayūrei... Delusion would need to be convinced she could gain something by attacking it. ... Enough of her, at least...
Is Hachi-chan right? Do you know where and when this special person of yours was taken?
He was taken a while ago, Kanchou. Long enough for her to take him, deposit him at Ryūgū-jō and make an appearance in the Bay of Bengal. ... She may also have still had him, then...
Either way, she visited North Sentinel Island so she couldn’t be connected to all this.
She’s doing what we do.
Damn! If we’d known from the start...
There was concern that if it was known Injustice - *this* Injustice - was involved, the Protection Fleet might have considered it too risky to send you on this mission.

Fields.MenuText: I doubt that. Making Morganas’ lives miserable and short - anytime and anywhere - is what the Fleet does. We don’t just walk where angels fear to tread, Ensign. We patrol there.
Or we would have been the top first of a very short list. This is just another day’s work for the Protection Fleet, Yamada.
There was probably greater concern that having to deal on her terms like this is an embarrassment. The fewer people that know she pulled this off, the better.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand that now, Kanchou.
From what I have seen in just my short time aboard, I believe you.
Whoops. Did I say that out loud?
... Point taken, Kanchou.
Company?
Hai. It seems the ensign has time to formulate his answer.
@BATTLE
Hachi-chan, you’re absolutely sure? The Kerguelen Archipelago is no place to visit unless we have to.
I stake my honor on it, Kanchou. North Sentinel Island, Samoa and the waters off Shanghai are all points on the circle. That circle includes the archipelago’s main island.
Hahajima isn’t on the circle, though.
Only Corruption was there, not Injustice.  Corruption was at that place only to impart the song and guide me to her, nothing more.
That and put you in a net...
You can’t sing if you aren’t on the surface. That time, I was the "circle" and she was the "oni." I just didn’t know it then.

Fields.MenuText: Venom wasn’t singing either, and she didn’t get the net treatment.
If Corruption could get the point across just by humming, you can too. And you don’t need to be on the surface to do that.
Worrying about a silly game is unnecessary, especially when playing a match with only two, Hachi-chan. There’s only one answer to "who’s behind you," singing or not.

Fields.DialogueText: That’s one thing about Injustice that is honorable... she will at least acknowledge rules exist even as she’s flaunting them. I expect nothing from Venom but cutthroat acts.
You may be right.
A valid point, Kanchou.
I’ll give you that the Desolation Islands are about as "below the seas" on the map as you can get, and not many other places on your circle are as remote.
But what if she brought in an artificial island - say, a Morgana drilling station - to set up somewhere else on your circle?
Because of the words... and her temperament. "In the night of dawn, the crane and the turtle slipped." The four cardinal directions are bad, which means she’s offering the middle directions.
That narrows things down... and the islands are to the southwest. But that still leaves three other directions, Hachi-chan.
That is where her temperament comes into play, Kanchou. Northeast on a compass is unlucky and known as the Kimon: the Oni’s gate.
She is always referring to you as oni... and the Kerguelen Archipelago is what I face if I turn my back on the oni’s gate.
Cute. That’s assuming Injustice is using the same compass as the rest of us though.
I believe so. The location of her first appearance would be her "north" - hers and the chart’s just happen to agree.
So that’s why you grilled Yamada: to confirm she was there.
... I wasn’t too severe, was I? If I have damaged cooperation between the ranks...
Too severe? You applied just enough pressure to get our less than co-operative ensign to offer what we shouldn’t have to ask for in the first place.
You’re even reflecting on it to make sure. You’re good, Hachi-chan.
... The weather in the Roaring Forties, on the other hand, won’t be. Looks like we have some preparations to make...
@BATTLE
Out of the Roaring Forties, into the Furious Fifties. Trust Injustice to pick a spot impossible for aerial reconnaissance.
I’d prefer to have more aids to keep from getting lost as well, but... it can’t be helped.
I know. On the plus side, we can stay underwater where the ride is smoother. ... And if we start running into Antarctica, we’ll know we’ve gone too far.
I hope not to do that. But you do have a point, Kanchou, the wind and waves may be troublesome, but they are no friend to any Funayūrei on the surface, either.
Only a reckless idiot with no sense of self-preservation would be foolish enough to-
HALLOOOO! I’M LOST! ... Wait... NO! CONFUSED! ... CONFUSION! ... And,     and CONFUSION IS LOST!
@BATTLE
*whispering* We're coming up on La Grande Terre, Kanchou.
*whispering* Enemy presence?
*whispering* ... It's significant, Kanchou. And they seem largely feral; the dominant group is pummeling a Paranoia.
*whispering* Well, clearly, that's our job.
@BATTLE
*whispering* Tell the rest of the group to hang back. It's worth trying to scout underwater before engaging the Paranoia directly.
*whispering* Hai. But, Kanchou, I don't think our VIP is aboard her - I'm seeing lights from the old observatory at Morbihan Bay.
*whispering* So Paranoia has been posted as a guard dog, maybe? And the Malice group just came along to kick her for sport...
*whispering* Can you confirm she's in as bad a state as I think she is?
*whispering* When we get a bit closer.
*whispering* Careful.
*whispering* Rest assured, Kanchou, that I have learned a few things since Haha-jima. First, to test the waters for nets...
I know you’re out there, I-8. Injustice said she invited you come, so it’s all right.
*whispering* Her engines are a mess, Kanchou. I can tell you that from here.
I know that she’s been playing some sort of game with you. It’s all right, There’s no need for that. There’s only two of us anyway, so we don’t have to play.
*whispering* See that blast site, Kanchou? Ammunition storage. And every gun I can make out has been wrecked too.
You... you really shouldn’t keep this gentleman waiting, I-8. Now that you’re here, you really should come up so that he can go home.
*whispering* I think she's defenseless, Kanchou. I don't think this is an act.
You... you’re being rather rude, about this, I-8.
... Are you trying to make me upset? That’s not very ni-
OH HO HO HO HO!
Hachi-chan?
Where are you? Come out! Now!
Did they blind you, too, Funayūrei? So sad!
Still, Injustice sent you here to play a game. Let's play!
S-stop.
Kaaaagome... Kagomeeee...
Hachi-chan.
Since you miserable Funayūrei first attacked my home, you've been so smug. So superior, even in your madness.
PLAYING GAMES!
Well, this is how it feels when you lose.

Fields.MenuText: You're starting to worry me, Hachi-chan.
Our priority is the hostage, Hachi-chan.
Hachi-chan. She's defenseless, and there are lines we don't cross.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Kanchou?
But...
Do not despise an inferior enemy or fear a superior one. Remember?
You represent the Japanese people as well as the Neutrality Fleet. I don't think you want the face you show the world to be one of... gratuitous cruelty.
No matter how well deserved it might be.
You think... I was bringing dishonor... to His Imperial Majesty?

Fields.MenuText: No. You were just losing your temper. But let's not take it any farther.
I think you were on the verge of doing something you'd regret.
Look at her, Hachi-chan. She's already been mauled by her friends. She's no danger to anyone right now.

Fields.DialogueText: ... She's trying to run away.
Yeah. And we're headed for shore. We have a rescue to effect.
*static* --is this? Identify yourselves!
Your--! ... Sir! We have come to return you to your duties!
Yamada, I take it? It took you long enough.
Well, there they go.
Do you think we’ll see Ensign Yamada again?
We may meet a Yamada again...  but I don’t know if it will be that one.
Kanchou?
Both of the Japanese intelligence men we met in the course of this went by "Taro Yamada," didn't they?
Hai. It was an interesting coincidence!

Fields.MenuText: Hachi-chan, you don’t think his name is really Taro Yamada, do you?
Fair enough.
There’s about as much likelihood that his name and rank really is Ensign Taro Yamada as they are mine.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. What reason would he have to lie, Kanchou? ... Did I say something amusing?
No, sorry... I just had an unrelated, absurd thought. Carry on, Hachi-chan.
Hai.
... Hai.
That aside, I would imagine we will get new orders soon. I should probably go oversee departure preparations...
Take your time. The way these things usually work, until Injustice’s guest officially turns up safe and sound, we’re technically still out to sea.
I see. Then we can be clean and rested when we depart.
Our "guest" gave you a hard time, didn't he? Damn-
No, no, Kanchou. He said never said anything...
He didn't have to.
Just the same, Kanchou... there is no getting around the fact that while I may be large for a submarine, there are surface warships far larger and more... spacious than I am.
The cavalry rode in for him, Hachi-chan. If his nose was offended because our horses weren’t fresh from a dress parade, that’s his problem: you did your best.
I... thank you, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Don’t mention it. So long as we’re on the subject, should I be looking to go straight back to our usual haunts, or do you want to pick up an exotic patrol or two?
May I make a request?
... Kagome, Kagome...
Injustice.
Hachi. What brings a denizen of the Underworld to the surface? You wouldn’t be here waiting for me, now would you? I’m touched.
In more ways than one.
I gave you a trail to follow so that you can answer me.
You’re even here to talk with me? Wonderful! By all means, Hachi... ask anything you like!
Why.
That’s such a broad question, don’t you think? To “why,” I can only respond: because.
Why did you take him prisoner?
Much better. But he was never my prisoner, Hachi. I rescued him.
The Yamato people don’t surrender, after all... it’s why they didn’t ratify the Convention Relative to the Treatment of Prisoners of War.
You set him up to need rescuing.
Did I? I can’t seem to recall...
You made it clear the only one who could come rescue him was me.
Not rescue: return. He was my guest.

Fields.MenuText: Come into my parlor, said the spider to the fly...
Dress it up all you like, Injustice, but a hostage by any other name...
Is that where he picked up such rude habits?  It all makes sense to me now.

Fields.DialogueText: Trust an oni - it’s “Will you walk into my parlour?” said the spider to the fly...
Your oni says that like it’s a bad thing.
I am blameless for the behavior of oni. He learned nothing from me that he didn’t know before he stepped aboard his transport.
Either way, the proper answer is "Hell, no."
I never planned to keep him for long. I wouldn’t dream of interfering with his duties on the continent.
What was behind Kagome Kagome?
Oh, very nice turn of phrase, Hachi. There are so many ways to interpret it, aren’t there? Which one was my intent? All of them.
... And none of them. In the end, my goal was simply to play with you. But lately, you’ve been ever so difficult to meet...  You never call, you never write...
... So you forced the hand of His Imperial Majesty. I will never forgive you for that.
Vengeance is a motivator I understand, Hachi.
That was another reason I arranged all of this: to get you to solve my riddle, to try to predict me... to think as I do. It would appear I have succeeded, to an extent.
I’m sure I’ve given you much to think about, so I will retire... oh? What have you there? A glove?
Not that I ever use them, but a certain sempai of mine considers an officer’s uniform incomplete without them. Perhaps this is why. I believe you are familiar with the custom...
You’re really-! I’m honored. By all means, Hachi. Throw down the gauntlet... I can’t wait to take it up.
*splash*
Where is it, Hachi? ... Hachi... what did you do?
I filled it with sand. If you want it, go down and get it.
Heh.
Perhaps Confusion is right after all; you don’t need your orbs, Eye Ate. At this rate they’ll melt, trying to contain the fire in you.
Until we meet again, Hachi...  Oh, hello there, Sabotage.
Oh come on. That’s the oldest trick-
@BATTLE
Are you all right, Hachi-chan?
Damage from the battle has been contained. My batteries are all charged to capacity and my diesels are running on all cylinders, Kanchou.
You know what I mean.
*sigh* I accomplished my mission. I located the missing Army officer and returned him to his appointed duties.
You also put a healthy dose of fear, explosive warheads and a shell or two into a bunch of Morganas.
So why do I feel like I still lost?
Well, we did do all that off the record.
Does that matter to you? When I fight it is to preserve and protect my home and defeat her enemies, not for glory or medals. To fight and die for the Emperor is reward enough for me.

Fields.MenuText: You also fight to represent and defend through dutiful service, the unbridled honor of all submarines of the Empire of Japan, large and small.
I have no problem with keeping this little game to ourselves, Hachi-chan. You thought you were in demand before when it came to insight on Injustice. Now...
What matters to me is that Morganas ran amok because they landed an embarrassingly big fish. Being off the record didn’t make them go away and won’t prevent it from happening again.

Fields.DialogueText: ... And maybe to do that, too...
There would be no end to the questions. My apologies, Kanchou... you’ve thought this through more than I have.
No worries, Hachi-chan.
I suspect what’s bothering you is what Injustice said.
... She had me dancing to her tune and I didn’t even know it.  Her aim is to have me think like her, and... I don’t know how to stop her when I didn’t even realize she was doing it.
You know, a bit of insight into how she thinks isn’t necessarily a bad thing, Hachi-chan. If you didn’t have that we’d still be out to sea, in search of Ryūgū-jō.
... That is true.
You are still you, Hachi-chan. Just because you know how she thinks doesn’t mean you have to agree with her, or act as she does.
What is it?
A Kami of the Fleet. She’s responding to a lifeboat sighting. She says it’s damaged... origin unknown. All it has is a gift box with a card inside, addressed to me...
... And a severed tentacle. She thinks it belonged to Asphyxiation.
Tell her we're on the way. Maybe this is why you’re feeling like you are, Hachi-chan; this game isn’t over yet.
Kanchou...
I see them.
@BATTLE
